intro: Aerva incana, commonly known as silverleaf aerva, is a flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine, silver-white hairs. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and also covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving the plant its distinctive silvery appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
